column5: My wife and I were out today from about 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM. We intended to fish walleye SE of Wylie Point just above Big Narrows on a series of spots we had good luck on a few weeks ago. All day nothing, a few SM Bass on minnow tipped jigs where the walleye should have been, we casted for Bass a bit, one little one. Then around 4:00 pm I decided to try one last hump that had been productive before, sonar showed nothing, I decided to heave my jig and minnow as far away from the boat as possible and drag/pop it back to the boat and voila, walleye. After 7 hours of nothing, I caught a fish including several very nice ones almost every time I tossed it out. Probably 40 or so total, drive my wife nuts, every time she tried it she got snagged. Beautiful 9 hour day on the lake with 2 hours of catching and 7 hours of nothing.
Nice save with a good rally in the bottom of the 9th inning. Never give up! I guess that's why it's called fishing and not catching, right?
I've had times when you couldn't buy a walleye on live bait, but they jumped all over a fast moving paddle tail on a jig.Go figure.Pooch
